Scientific method IndexWriting

Counting

In this chapter we studied that the necessity to count has arisen millennia ago (History Tracers, 2024, The numbers in our life). We study different numerical representation were created over time, based in our body, a fact that led us to learn about an initial concept of limits (History Tracers, 2024, Making patterns). Next, we learned that because we always can append numbers to the side of another number, it is not possible to define the last number, so we expanded the concept of limit, instead to work as a maximum or minimum value, we began to work as a count that tends to a value. Thanks to this expansion, it was possible to learn that when numbers are growing, they tend to infinite, âˆž (History Tracers, 2024, The sky is the limit).

In different texts we were also presented to American indigenous and to the fact African people also created a way to count.

Grouping

After studying the logic behind the numbers, we began to study how the nature, by natural events, could group the matter since the first moments of the universe (History Tracers, 2024, Introduction to groups). In the sequence, we studied how the grouping of matter that is essential to life began (History Tracers, 2024, Groups of the life), and after this, it was studied distinct concepts for living beings (History Tracers, 2024, Living beings).

We finished this chapter presenting how scientific works are made and clarifying some confusions with the scientific method (History Tracers, 2024, Scientific method).

Next chapter

Now that we know, even if superficially, how the nature began to group matter, and how possibly we got here in our planet. In the next chapter, we begin to study the relationship between groups and continue to deepen our historical knowledge.
